member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Metadata.FindProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds the metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The search is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
member.returns: An that contains properties from the package that satisfy the condition.

list.item: More examples demonstrating usages of this method: Extracting metadata

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Metadata.UpdateProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean},GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.PropertyValue)
member.summary: Updates known metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
A new value for the filtered properties.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.
member.remarks:
Please note that GroupDocs.Metadata implicitly checks the type of each filtered property. It's impossible to update a property with a value having an inappropriate type.
Learn more
More examples demonstrating usages of this method: Updating metadata

member.summary: Removes metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate.

member.returns: The number of affected properties.

member.summary: Adds known metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well.

list.item: More examples demonstrating usages of this method: Adding metadata

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Metadata.SetProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean},GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.PropertyValue)
member.summary: Sets known metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well. This method is a combination of and . If an existing property satisfies the predicate its value is updated. If there is a known property missing in a package that satisfies the predicate it is added to the package.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
A new value for the filtered properties.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.
member.remarks:
Please note that GroupDocs.Metadata implicitly checks the type of each filtered property. It's impossible to set a property with a value having inappropriate type.
Learn more
Set metadata properties

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Metadata.Sanitize
member.summary: Removes writable metadata properties from all detected packages or whole packages if possible. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Tagging.PersonTagCategory
member.summary: Provides tags that mark metadata properties holding information about the people contributed to file or intellectual content creation. These tags can help you to find the document creator, editor or even the client for whom the work was performed. Despite the name of the category some metadata properties marked with the tags can contain a company name rather than a person's name.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Tagging.PersonTagCategory.Creator
member.summary: Gets the tag that denotes the original author of a file/document.
member.value: The tag that denotes the original author of a file/document.

members.member:
Gets the tag that labels a property containing the name of a person who somehow contributed to file creation. Please note that the tag is not applied towards metadata properties marked with more specific tags from this category. E.g. if a property labeled with the Creator tag.
The tag that labels a property containing the name of a person who somehow contributed to file creation. .

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Tagging.PersonTagCategory.Editor
member.summary: Gets the tag that labels a person who edited a file. The tag is usually used to mark a property containing information about the last editor.
member.value: The tag that labels a person who edited a file.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Tagging.PersonTagCategory.Model
member.summary: Gets the tag that denotes information about a person the content of the file is about. For photos that is a person shown in the image.
member.value: The tag that denotes information about a person the content of the file is about.

member.summary: Gets or sets the location the content is focusing on.

member.summary: Designates in the form CCYYMMDD the earliest date the provider intends the object to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: "19890317" indicates data for release on 17 March 1989.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcApplicationRecordDataSet.ReleaseTime
member.summary: Designates in the form HHMMSSHHMM the earliest time the provider intends the object to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: "090000-0500" indicates object for use after 0900 in New York (five hours behind UTC)

member.summary: Designates in the form CCYYMMDD the latest date the provider or owner intends the objectdata to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: Value '19940317' indicates an objectdata that should not be used after 17 March 1994.

member.summary: Represented in the form CCYYMMDD to designate the date the intellectual content of the objectdata was created rather than the date of the creation of the physical representation.
member.remarks: Follows ISO 8601 standard. Where the month or day cannot be determined, the information will be represented by 00. Where the year cannot be determined, the information for century and year will be represented by 00.
member.example: Value "19900127" indicates the intellectual content created on 27th January 1990.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcApplicationRecordDataSet.TimeCreated

member.remarks: Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: Value "133015+0100" indicates that the object intellectual content was created at 1:30 p.m. and 15 seconds Frankfurt time, one hour ahead of UTC.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcEnvelopeRecordDataSet
member.summary: Defines IPTC Envelope Record dataSet numbers.

summary.para:
A binary number identifying the version of the Information
Interchange Model, Part I, utilised by the provider. Version numbers are assigned by IPTC and NAA.
The version number of this record is four (4).

Optional, repeatable, maximum 1024 octets, consisting of sequentially contiguous graphic characters.
This DataSet is to accommodate some providers who require routing information above the appropriate OSI layers.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcEnvelopeRecordDataSet.FileFormat
member.summary: File format.

summary.para:
Mandatory, not repeatable, two octets.
A binary number representing the particular version of the File Format specified in 1:20.
A list of File Formats, including version cross references, is included as Appendix A.

Mandatory, not repeatable. Up to 10 octets, consisting of graphic characters.
Identifies the provider and product.

Mandatory, not repeatable, eight octets, consisting of numeric characters.
The characters form a number that will be unique for the date specified in 1:70 and for the Service Identifier specified in 1:30.
If identical envelope numbers appear with the same date and with the same Service Identifier, records 2-9 must be unchanged from the original.
This is not intended to be a sequential serial number reception check.

Optional, repeatable. Up to 32 octets, consisting of graphic characters.
Allows a provider to identify subsets of its overall service.
Used to provide receiving organization data on which to select, route, or otherwise handle data.

Optional, not repeatable. A single octet, consisting of a numeric character.
Specifies the envelope handling priority and not the editorial urgency (see 2:10, Urgency). '1' indicates the most urgent, '5' the normal urgency, and '8' the least urgent copy. The numeral '9' indicates a User Defined Priority. The numeral '0' is reserved for future use.

Mandatory, not repeatable. Eight octets, consisting of numeric characters.
Uses the format CCYYMMDD (century, year, month, day) as defined in ISO 8601 to indicate year, month and day the service sent the material.

Uses the format HHMMSSHHMM where HHMMSS refers to local hour, minute and seconds and HHMM refers to hours and minutes ahead (+) or behind (-) Universal Coordinated Time as described in ISO 8601. This is the time the service sent the material.

Optional, not repeatable, up to 32 octets, consisting of one or more control functions used for the announcement, invocation or designation of coded character sets. The control functions follow the ISO 2022 standard and may consist of the escape control character and one or more graphic characters. For more details see Appendix C, the IPTC-NAA Code Library.

member.summary: Invalid (eternal identifier).

member.summary: Adds the specified dataSet to the appropriate record. The dataSet is considered as repeatable if a dataSet with the specified number already exists.

member.summary: Removes the dataSet with the specified record and dataSet number.
member.returns: True if the specified IPTC dataSet is found and removed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Removes all records from the collection.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcRecordSet.Remove(System.Byte)

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsAltitudeRef
member.summary: Represents a GPS altitude reference.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsAltitudeRef.AboveSeaLevel
member.summary: Above sea level.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsAltitudeRef.BelowSeaLevel
member.summary: Below sea level.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage
member.summary: Represents GPS metadata in an EXIF metadata package.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.Altitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the altitude based on the reference in . The reference unit is meters.
member.value: The altitude based on the reference in .

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.AltitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the altitude used as the reference altitude. If the reference is sea level and the altitude is above sea level, 0 is given. If the altitude is below sea level, a value of 1 is given and the altitude is indicated as an absolute value in the tag.
member.value: The altitude used as the reference altitude

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.AreaInformation
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string recording the name of the GPS area. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the GPS area.
member.value: The character string recording the name of the GPS area.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DateStamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string recording date and time information relative to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). The format is YYYY:MM:DD.
member.value: The character string recording date and time information relative to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). The format is YYYY:MM:DD.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DestBearing
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS bearing to the destination point. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.
member.value: The bearing to the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DestBearingRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.
member.value: The GPS reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DestDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS distance to the destination point.
member.value: The distance to the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DestDistanceRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS unit used to express the distance to the destination point. 'K', 'M' and 'N' represent kilometers, miles and knots.
member.value: The GPS unit used to express the distance to the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DestLatitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS latitude of the destination point.
member.value: The latitude of the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DestLatitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS value which indicates whether the latitude of the destination point is north or south latitude. The ASCII value 'N' indicates north latitude, and 'S' is south latitude.
member.value: The GPS value which indicates whether the latitude of the destination point is north or south latitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DestLongitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS longitude of the destination point.
member.value: The GPS longitude of the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DestLongitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS value which indicates whether the longitude of the destination point is east or west longitude. ASCII 'E' indicates east longitude, and 'W' is west longitude.
member.value: The GPS value which indicates whether the longitude of the destination point is east or west longitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.Differential
member.summary: Gets or sets a GPS value which indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver.
member.value: A GPS value which indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.DataDegreeOfPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS DOP (data degree of precision). An HDOP value is written during two-dimensional measurement, and PDOP during three-dimensional measurement.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.ImgDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS direction of the image when it was captured. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.
member.value: The GPS direction of the image when it was captured.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.ImgDirectionRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.
member.value: The GPS reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.Latitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS latitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.LatitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets a GPS value indicating whether the latitude is north or south latitude.
member.value: A GPS value indicating whether the latitude is north or south latitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.Longitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS longitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.LongitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets a GPS value indicating whether the longitude is east or west longitude.
member.value: A GPS value indicating whether the longitude is east or west longitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.MapDatum
member.summary: Gets or sets the geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver.
member.value: The geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.MeasureMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS measurement mode.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.ProcessingMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets a character string recording the name of the method used for location finding. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the method.
member.value: A character string recording the name of the method used for location finding.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.Satellites
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS satellites used for measurements. This tag can be used to describe the number of satellites, their ID number, angle of elevation, azimuth, SNR and other information in ASCII notation. The format is not specified. If the GPS receiver is incapable of taking measurements, value of the tag shall be set to NULL.
member.value: The GPS satellites used for measurements.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.Speed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed of GPS receiver movement.
member.value: The speed of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.SpeedRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement. 'K' 'M' and 'N' represents kilometers per hour, miles per hour, and knots.
member.value: The unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded.
member.value: The status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.TimeStamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the time as UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). TimeStamp is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the hour, minute, and second.
member.value: The time as UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.GpsTrack
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of GPS receiver movement.
member.value: The direction of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.TrackRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference for giving the direction of GPS receiver movement. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.
member.value: The reference for giving the direction of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.VersionID
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of GPS IFD.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifIfdPackage
member.summary: Represents the Exif Image File Directory. Exif IFD is a set of tags for recording Exif-specific attribute information.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifIfdPackage.CameraOwnerName
member.summary: Gets or sets the camera owner's name.
member.value: The name of the camera owner.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifIfdPackage.BodySerialNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the camera body serial number.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifIfdPackage.CfaPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used.
member.value: The color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifIfdPackage.UserComment
member.summary: Gets or sets the user comment.

member.summary: Represents an EXIF metadata package (Exchangeable Image File Format).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.GpsPackage
member.summary: Gets the GPS data.

member.summary: Gets the EXIF IFD data.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.Thumbnail
member.summary: Gets the image thumbnail represented as an array of bytes.
member.value: The image thumbnail represented as an array of bytes.
member.remarks: This feature is not available in trial mode.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.Artist
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the camera owner, photographer or image creator.
member.value: The name of the camera owner, photographer or image creator.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.Copyright
member.summary: Gets or sets the copyright notice.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.DateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time of image creation. In the EXIF standard, it is the date and time the file was changed.
member.value: The date and time of image creation.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.ImageDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets a character string giving the title of the image. It may be a comment such as "1988 company picnic" or the like.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.ImageLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows of image data.
member.value: The number of rows of image data.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.ImageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns of image data, equal to the number of pixels per row.
member.value: The number of columns of image data, equal to the number of pixels per row.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.Make
member.summary: Gets or sets the manufacturer of the recording equipment. This is the manufacturer of the DSC, scanner, video digitizer or other equipment that generated the image.
member.value: The manufacturer of the recording equipment.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.Model
member.summary: Gets or sets the model name or model number of the equipment. This is the model name or number of the DSC, scanner, video digitizer or other equipment that generated the image.
member.value: The model name or model number of the equipment.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifPackage.Software
member.summary: Gets or sets the name and version of the software or firmware of the camera or image input device used to generate the image.
member.value: The name and version of the software or firmware of the camera or image input device used to generate the image.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage
member.summary: Represents a Dublin Core metadata package.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Contributor
member.summary: Gets the contributor Dublin Core element.
member.value: An entity responsible for making contributions to the content of the resource. Examples of a Contributor include a person, an organization or a service.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Coverage
member.summary: Gets the coverage Dublin Core element.
member.value: The extent or scope of the content of the resource. Coverage will typically include spatial location (a place name or geographic co-ordinates), temporal period (a period label, date, or date range) or jurisdiction (such as a named administrative entity).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Creator
member.summary: Gets the creator Dublin Core element.
member.value: An entity primarily responsible for making the content of the resource. Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Date
member.summary: Gets the date Dublin Core element.
member.value: A date associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource. Typically, Date will be associated with the creation or availability of the resource. Recommended best practice for encoding the date value is defined in a profile of ISO 8601 and follows the YYYY-MM-DD format.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Description
member.summary: Gets the description Dublin Core element.
member.value: An account of the content of the resource. Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, table of contents, reference to a graphical representation of content or a free-text account of the content.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Format
member.summary: Gets the format Dublin Core element.
member.value: The physical or digital manifestation of the resource. Typically, Format may include the media-type or dimensions of the resource. Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Format may be used to determine the software, hardware or other equipment needed to display or operate the resource.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Language
member.summary: Gets the language Dublin Core element.
member.value: A language of the intellectual content of the resource. Recommended best practice for the values of the Language element is defined by RFC 3066 which, in conjunction with ISO 639), defines two- and three-letter primary language tags with optional subtags.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Publisher
member.summary: Gets the publisher Dublin Core element.
member.value: The entity responsible for making the resource available. Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Relation
member.summary: Gets the relation Dublin Core element.
member.value: A reference to a related resource. Recommended best practice is to reference the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Source
member.summary: Gets the source Dublin Core element.
member.value: A Reference to a resource from which the present resource is derived. The present resource may be derived from the Source resource in whole or part. Recommended best practice is to reference the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Subject
member.summary: Gets the subject Dublin Core element.
member.value: The topic of the content of the resource. Typically, a Subject will be expressed as keywords or key phrases or classification codes that describe the topic of the resource. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary or formal classification scheme.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Title
member.summary: Gets the title Dublin Core element.
member.value: The name given to the resource. Typically, a Title will be a name by which the resource is formally known.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Type
member.summary: Gets the type Dublin Core element.
member.value: The nature or genre of the content of the resource. Type includes terms describing general categories, functions, genres, or aggregation levels for content. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the DCMIType vocabulary).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Rights
member.summary: Gets the rights Dublin Core element.
member.value: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically a Rights element will contain a rights management statement for the resource, or reference a service providing such information. Rights information often encompasses Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), Copyright, and various Property Rights. If the rights element is absent, no assumptions can be made about the status of these and other rights with respect to the resource.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Identifier
member.summary: Gets the identifier Dublin Core element.
member.value: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context. Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.summary: Represents a digital sign created with Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) - IETF's standard for cryptographically protected messages. CMS is based on the syntax of PKCS #7, specified in RFC 5652. Please see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5652 for more information.

member.value: The signed content, consisting of a content type identifier and the content itself.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Pkcs.Cms.Certificates
member.summary: Gets the collection of certificates.
member.remarks: It is intended that the set of certificates be sufficient to contain certification paths from a recognized "root" or "top-level certification authority" to all of the signers in the SignerInfo field.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Pkcs.Cms.Signers
member.summary: Gets the collection of per-signer information packages.
member.remarks: There may be any number of elements in the collection, including zero.
member.value: The collection of per-signer information packages.

member.summary: Gets the time at which the signer (purportedly) performed the signing process.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader
member.summary: Represents the AVIMAINHEADER structure in an AVI video.

item.a: Working with metadata in AVI files

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.MicroSecPerFrame
member.summary: Gets the the number of microseconds between frames. This value indicates the overall timing for the file.
member.value: The number of microseconds between frames.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.MaxBytesPerSec

summary.para:
Gets the approximate maximum data rate of the file.
This value indicates the number of bytes per second the system must handle to present an AVI sequence as specified by the other parameters contained in the main header and stream header chunks.

member.value: The the approximate maximum data rate of the file.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.PaddingGranularity
member.summary: Gets the alignment for data, in bytes. Pad the data to multiples of this value.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.AviHeaderFlags
member.summary: Gets a bitwise combination of zero or more of the AVI flags.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.TotalFrames
member.summary: Gets the the total number of frames of data in the file.

summary.para:
Gets the initial frame for interleaved files.
Noninterleaved files should specify zero. If you are creating interleaved files, specify the number of frames in the file prior to the initial frame of the AVI sequence in this member.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.Streams
member.summary: Gets the number of streams in the file. For example, a file with audio and video has two streams.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.SuggestedBufferSize

summary.para:
Gets the suggested buffer size for reading the file.
Generally, this size should be large enough to contain the largest chunk in the file. If set to zero, or if it is too small, the playback software will have to reallocate memory during playback, which will reduce performance. For an interleaved file, the buffer size should be large enough to read an entire record, and not just a chunk.

member.value: The suggested buffer size for reading the file.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of the AVI file in pixels.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the AVI file in pixels.

member.summary: Represents AVI Header flags.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.HasIndex
member.summary: Indicates the AVI file has an index.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.MustUseIndex
member.summary: Indicates that application should use the index, rather than the physical ordering of the chunks in the file, to determine the order of presentation of the data. For example, this flag could be used to create a list of frames for editing.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.IsInterleaved
member.summary: Indicates the AVI file is interleaved.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.TrustCkType
member.summary: Use CKType to find key frames.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.WasCaptureFile
member.summary: Indicates the AVI file is a specially allocated file used for capturing real-time video. Applications should warn the user before writing over a file with this flag set because the user probably defragmented this file.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.Copyrighted
member.summary: Indicates the AVI file contains copyrighted data and software. When this flag is used, software should not permit the data to be duplicated.

member.summary: Gets the track number as used in the Block Header. Using more than 127 tracks is not encouraged, though the design allows an unlimited number.
member.value: The track number as used in the Block Header.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.TrackUid
member.summary: Gets the unique ID to identify the Track. This SHOULD be kept the same when making a direct stream copy of the Track to another file.
member.value: The unique ID to identify the Track.

member.summary: Gets the type of the track.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.FlagEnabled
member.summary: Gets the enabled flag, true if the track is usable.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.DefaultDuration
member.summary: Gets the number of nanoseconds (not scaled via ) per frame.
member.remarks: Note: 'frame' in the Matroska sense -- one Element put into a (Simple)Block.
member.value: The number of nanoseconds (not scaled via ) per frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.Name
member.summary: Gets the human-readable track name.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.Language
member.summary: Gets the language of the track in the Matroska languages form. This Element MUST be ignored if the Element is used in the same TrackEntry.
member.remarks: Language codes can be either the 3 letters bibliographic ISO-639-2 form (like "fre" for french), or such a language code followed by a dash and a country code for specialities in languages(like "fre-ca" for Canadian French). Country codes are the same as used for internet domains.
member.value: The language of the track in the Matroska languages form.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.LanguageIetf
member.summary: Gets the language of the track according to BCP 47 and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry. If this Element is used, then any Elements used in the same TrackEntry MUST be ignored.
member.value: The language of the track according to BCP 47 and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry.

member.summary: Gets an ID corresponding to the codec.

member.value: An ID corresponding to the codec.

member.summary: Gets a human-readable string specifying the codec.
member.value: A human-readable string specifying the codec.

summary.para:
Represents a Photoshop Image Resource block.
Image resource blocks are the basic building unit of several file formats, including Photoshop's native file format, JPEG, and TIFF. Image resources are used to store non-pixel data associated with images, such as pen tool paths.

item.a: Working with metadata in PSD images

member.summary: IPTC-NAA record. Contains the File Info... information. See the documentation in the IPTC folder of the Documentation folder.

member.summary: Image mode for raw format files.

member.summary: Thumbnail resource for Photoshop 4.0 only.

member.summary: Copyright flag. Boolean indicating whether image is copyrighted. Can be set via Property suite or by user in File Info...

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.UrlPhotoshop4
member.summary: URL. Handle of a text string with uniform resource locator. Can be set via Property suite or by user in File Info...

member.summary: Thumbnail resource (supersedes resource 1033). See See Thumbnail resource format.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.GlobalAnglePhotoshop5
member.summary: Global Angle. 4 bytes that contain an integer between 0 and 359, which is the global lighting angle for effects layer. If not present, assumed to be 30.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.IccProfilePhotoshop5
member.summary: (Photoshop 5.0) ICC Profile. The raw bytes of an ICC (International Color Consortium) format profile. See ICC1v42_2006-05.pdf in the Documentation folder and icProfileHeader.h in Sample Code\Common\Includes.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.WatermarkPhotoshop5
member.summary: Watermark. One byte.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.IccUntaggedProfilePhotoshop5
member.summary: ICC Untagged Profile. 1 byte that disables any assumed profile handling when opening the file. 1 = intentionally untagged.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.TransparencyIndexPhotoshop6
member.summary: Transparency Index. 2 bytes for the index of transparent color, if any.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.GlobalAltitudePhotoshop6
member.summary: Global Altitude. 4 byte entry for altitude.

member.summary: Slices (Photoshop 6).

member.summary: Workflow URL. Unicode string. Photoshop 6.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.AlphaIdentifiersPhotoshop6
member.summary: Alpha Identifiers. 4 bytes of length, followed by 4 bytes each for every alpha identifier.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.UrlListPhotoshop6
member.summary: URL InternalList. 4 byte count of URLs, followed by 4 byte long, 4 byte ID, and Unicode string for each count.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.VersionInfoPhotoshop6
member.summary: Version Info. 4 bytes version, 1 byte hasRealMergedData , Unicode string: writer name, Unicode string: reader name, 4 bytes file version.

member.summary: EXIF data 1, see more.

member.summary: XMP metadata. File info as XML description, see more.

member.summary: Caption digest. 16 bytes: RSA Data Security, MD5 message-digest algorithm.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PrintScalePhotoshop7
member.summary: Print scale. 2 bytes style (0 = centered, 1 = size to fit, 2 = user defined). 4 bytes x location (floating point). 4 bytes y location (floating point). 4 bytes scale (floating point).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PixelAspectRatio
member.summary: Pixel Aspect Ratio. 4 bytes (version = 1 or 2), 8 bytes double, x / y of a pixel. Version 2, attempting to correct values for NTSC and PAL, previously off by a factor of approx. 5%.

member.summary: Layer Comps. 4 bytes (descriptor version = 16), Descriptor.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod
member.summary: Defines the compression method used for image data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod.Raw
member.summary: No compression. The image data stored as raw bytes in RGBA planar order. That means that first all R data is written, then all G is written, then all B and finally all A data is written.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod.Rle
member.summary: RLE compressed. The image data starts with the byte counts for all the scan lines (rows * channels), with each count stored as a two-byte value. The RLE compressed data follows, with each scan line compressed separately. The RLE compression is the same compression algorithm used by the Macintosh ROM routine PackBits and the TIFF standard.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod.ZipWithoutPrediction
member.summary: ZIP without prediction.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod.ZipWithPrediction
member.summary: ZIP with prediction.

member.summary: Indicates the altitude used as the reference altitude.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsAltitude
member.summary: Indicates the altitude based on the reference in GPSAltitudeRef.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsTimeStamp
member.summary: Indicates the time as UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsSatellites
member.summary: ndicates the GPS satellites used for measurements.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsMeasureMode
member.summary: Indicates the GPS measurement mode.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDop
member.summary: Indicates the GPS DOP (data degree of precision).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsSpeedRef
member.summary: Indicates the unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsSpeed
member.summary: Indicates the speed of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsTrackRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference for giving the direction of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsTrack
member.summary: Indicates the direction of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsImgDirectionRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsImgDirection
member.summary: Indicates the direction of the image when it was captured.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsMapDatum
member.summary: Indicates the geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDestLatitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the latitude of the destination point is north or south latitude.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDestLatitude
member.summary: Indicates the latitude of the destination point.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDestLongitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the longitude of the destination point is east or west longitude.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDestLongitude
member.summary: Indicates the longitude of the destination point.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDestBearingRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDestBearing
member.summary: Indicates the bearing to the destination point.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDestDistanceRef
member.summary: Indicates the unit used to express the distance to the destination point.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDestDistance
member.summary: Indicates the distance to the destination point.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsProcessingMethod
member.summary: A character string recording the name of the method used for location finding.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsAreaInformation
member.summary: A character string recording the name of the GPS area.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDateStamp
member.summary: A character string recording date and time information relative to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsDifferential
member.summary: Indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsHPositioningError
member.summary: This tag indicates horizontal positioning errors in meters.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.NewSubfileType
member.summary: A general indication of the kind of data contained in this sub-file.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SubfileType
member.summary: A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile. This field is deprecated. The NewSubfileType field should be used instead

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ImageWidth
member.summary: The number of columns in the image, i.e., the number of pixels per scan line.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ImageLength
member.summary: The number of rows (sometimes described as scan lines) in the image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Number of bits per component.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Compression
member.summary: Compression scheme used on the image data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.PhotometricInterpretation
member.summary: The color space of the image data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Threshholding
member.summary: For black and white TIFF files that represent shades of gray, the technique used to convert from gray to black and white pixels.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.CellWidth
member.summary: The width of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bi-level file.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.CellLength
member.summary: The length of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bi-level file.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FillOrder
member.summary: The logical order of bits within a byte.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.DocumentName
member.summary: The name of the document from which this image was scanned.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ImageDescription
member.summary: A string that describes the subject of the image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Make
member.summary: The scanner manufacturer.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Model
member.summary: The scanner model name or number.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.StripOffsets
member.summary: For each strip, the byte offset of that strip.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Orientation
member.summary: The orientation of the image with respect to the rows and columns.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SamplesPerPixel
member.summary: The number of components per pixel.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.RowsPerStrip
member.summary: The number of rows per strip.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.StripByteCounts
member.summary: For each strip, the number of bytes in the strip after compression.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.MinSampleValue
member.summary: The minimum component value used.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.MaxSampleValue
member.summary: The maximum component value used.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.XResolution
member.summary: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageWidth direction.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.YResolution
member.summary: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageLength direction.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.PlanarConfiguration
member.summary: How the components of each pixel are stored.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.PageName
member.summary: The name of the page from which this image was scanned.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.XPosition
member.summary: X position of the image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.YPosition
member.summary: Y position of the image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FreeOffsets
member.summary: For each string of contiguous unused bytes in a TIFF file, the byte offset of the string.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FreeByteCounts
member.summary: For each string of contiguous unused bytes in a TIFF file, the number of bytes in the string.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GrayResponseUnit
member.summary: The precision of the information contained in the GrayResponseCurve.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GrayResponseCurve
member.summary: For grayscale data, the optical density of each possible pixel value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.T4Options
member.summary: T4-encoding options.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.T6Options
member.summary: T6-encoding options.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ResolutionUnit
member.summary: The unit of measurement for XResolution and YResolution.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.PageNumber
member.summary: The page number of the page from which this image was scanned.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TransferFunction
member.summary: Describes a transfer function for the image in tabular style. Pixel components can be gamma-compensated, companded, non-uniformly quantized, or coded in some other way. The TransferFunction maps the pixel components from a non-linear BitsPerSample (e.g. 8-bit) form into a 16-bit linear form without a perceptible loss of accuracy.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Software
member.summary: Name and version number of the software package(s) used to create the image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time of image creation.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Artist
member.summary: Person who created the image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.HostComputer
member.summary: The computer and/or operating system in use at the time of image creation.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Predictor
member.summary: This section defines a Predictor that greatly improves compression ratios for some images.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.WhitePoint
member.summary: The chromaticity of the white point of the image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.PrimaryChromaticities
member.summary: The chromaticities of the primaries of the image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ColorMap
member.summary: A color map for palette color images.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.HalftoneHints
member.summary: The purpose of the HalftoneHints field is to convey to the halftone function the range of gray levels within a colorimetrically-specified image that should retain tonal detail.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TileWidth
member.summary: The tile width in pixels. This is the number of columns in each tile.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TileLength
member.summary: The tile length (height) in pixels. This is the number of rows in each tile.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TileOffsets
member.summary: For each tile, the byte offset of that tile, as compressed and stored on disk. The offset is specified with respect to the beginning of the TIFF file. Note that this implies that each tile has a location independent of the locations of other tiles.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TileByteCounts
member.summary: For each tile, the number of (compressed) bytes in that tile.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.InkSet
member.summary: The set of inks used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.InkNames
member.summary: The name of each ink used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image, written as a list of concatenated, NUL-terminated ASCII strings.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.NumberOfInks
member.summary: The number of inks. Usually equal to SamplesPerPixel, unless there are extra samples.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.DotRange
member.summary: The component values that correspond to a 0% dot and 100% dot. DotRange[0] corresponds to a 0% dot, and DotRange[1] corresponds to a 100% dot.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ExtraSamples
member.summary: Description of extra components.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SampleFormat
member.summary: This field specifies how to interpret each data sample in a pixel.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SMinSampleValue
member.summary: This field specifies the minimum sample value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SMaxSampleValue
member.summary: This new field specifies the maximum sample value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TransferRange
member.summary: Expands the range of the TransferFunction.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegProc
member.summary: This Field indicates the JPEG process used to produce the compressed data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegInterchangeFormat
member.summary: This Field indicates whether a JPEG interchange format bitstream is present in the TIFF file.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegInterchangeFormatLength
member.summary: This Field indicates the length in bytes of the JPEG interchange format bitstream

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegRestartInterval
member.summary: This Field indicates the length of the restart interval used in the compressed image data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegLosslessPredictors
member.summary: This Field points to a list of lossless predictor-selection values, one per component.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegPointTransforms
member.summary: This Field points to a list of point transform values, one per component.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegQTables
member.summary: This Field points to a list of offsets to the quantization tables, one per component.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegDCTables
member.summary: This Field points to a list of offsets to the DC Huffman tables or the lossless Huffman tables, one per component.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.JpegACTables
member.summary: This Field points to a list of offsets to the Huffman AC tables, one per component.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.YCbCrCoefficients
member.summary: The matrix cofficients for transformation from RGB to YCbCr image data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.YCbCrSubSampling
member.summary: The sampling ratio of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.YCbCrPositioning
member.summary: Specifies the positioning of subsampled chrominance components relative to luminance samples.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ReferenceBlackWhite
member.summary: Specifies a pair of headroom and footroom image data values (codes) for each pixel component.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Copyright
member.summary: Copyright notice.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.UserComment
member.summary: Keywords or comments on the image; complements ImageDescription.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Xmp
member.summary: Pointer to the XMP metadata.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ImageID
member.summary: OPI-related.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Iptc
member.summary: IPTC (International Press Telecommunications Council) metadata. Often times, the data type is incorrectly specified as LONG.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Photoshop
member.summary: Collection of Photoshop 'Image Resource Blocks'.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ImageLayer
member.summary: Image layer.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.IccProfile
member.summary: Color profile data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ExifIfd
member.summary: Pointer to collection of all EXIF Metadata. EXIF uses field names rather than tags to indicate the field content.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GpsIfd
member.summary: Pointer to GPS data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Makernotes
member.summary: Pointer to makernotes data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.InteroperabilityIfd
member.summary: Exif-related Interoperability IFD.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.CameraOwnerName
member.summary: Camera owner name as ASCII string.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.BodySerialNumber
member.summary: Camera body serial number as ASCII string.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.CfaPattern
member.summary: ndicates the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used. It does not apply to all sensing methods.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ExifVersion
member.summary: The version of the EXIF standard supported.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ComponentsConfiguration
member.summary: Information specific to the compressed data. The channels of each component are arranged in order from the 1st component to the 4th.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FlashpixVersion
member.summary: The Flashpix format version supported by a FPXR file. If the FPXR function supports Flashpix format Ver. 1.0, this is indicated similarly to ExifVersion by recording "0100" as 4-byte ASCII.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ColorSpace
member.summary: The color space information tag (ColorSpace) is always recorded as the color space specifier. Normally sRGB (=1) is used to define the color space based on the PC monitor conditions and environment. If a color space other than sRGB is used, Uncalibrated (=FFFF.H) is set.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.PixelXDimension
member.summary: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid width of the meaningful image shall be recorded in this tag, whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.PixelYDimension
member.summary: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid height of the meaningful image shall be recorded in this tag, whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SceneCaptureType
member.summary: This tag indicates the type of scene that was shot. It may also be used to record the mode in which the image was shot.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Gamma
member.summary: Indicates the value of coefficient gamma.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.CompressedBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Information specific to compressed data. The compression mode used for a compressed image is indicated in unit bits per pixel.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.RelatedSoundFile
member.summary: This tag is used to record the name of an audio file related to the image data. The only relational information recorded here is the Exif audio file name and extension (an ASCII string consisting of 8 characters + '.' + 3 characters).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.DateTimeOriginal
member.summary: The date and time when the original image data was generated. For a DSC the date and time the picture was taken are recorded. The format is "YYYY:MM:DD HH:MM:SS" with time shown in 24-hour format, and the date and time separated by one blank character.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.DateTimeDigitized
member.summary: The date and time when the image was stored as digital data. If, for example, an image was captured by DSC and at the same time the file was recorded, then the DateTimeOriginal and DateTimeDigitized will have the same contents. The format is "YYYY:MM:DD HH:MM:SS" with time shown in 24-hour format, and the date and time separated by one blank character.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.OffsetTime
member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTime tag. The format when recording the offset is "HH:MM". The part of "" shall be recorded as "+" or "-".

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.OffsetTimeOriginal
member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTimeOriginal tag. The format when recording the offset is "HH:MM". The part of "" shall be recorded as "+" or "-".

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.OffsetTimeDigitized
member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTimeDigitized tag. The format when recording the offset is "HH:MM". The part of "" shall be recorded as "+" or "-".

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SubsecTime
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTime tag.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SubsecTimeOriginal
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeOriginal tag.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SubsecTimeDigitized
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeDigitized tag.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ExposureTime
member.summary: Exposure time, given in seconds (sec).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FNumber
member.summary: The F number.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ExposureProgram
member.summary: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SpectralSensitivity
member.summary: Indicates the spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used. The tag value is an ASCII string compatible with the standard developed by the ASTM Technical committee.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.PhotographicSensitivity
member.summary: This tag indicates the sensitivity of the camera or input device when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Oecf
member.summary: Indicates the Opto-Electric Conversion Function (OECF) specified in ISO 14524. OECF is the relationship between the camera optical input and the image values.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SensitivityType
member.summary: The SensitivityType tag indicates which one of the parameters of ISO12232 is the PhotographicSensitivity tag. Although it is an optional tag, it should be recorded when a PhotographicSensitivity tag is recorded.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.StandardOutputSensitivity
member.summary: This tag indicates the standard output sensitivity value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.RecommendedExposureIndex
member.summary: This tag indicates the recommended exposure index value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.IsoSpeed
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ISOSpeedLatitudeYyy
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude yyy value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ISOSpeedLatitudeZzz
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude zzz value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ShutterSpeedValue
member.summary: Shutter speed. The unit is the APEX (Additive System of Photographic Exposure) setting.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ApertureValue
member.summary: The lens aperture. The unit is the APEX value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.BrightnessValue
member.summary: The value of brightness. The unit is the APEX value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ExposureBiasValue
member.summary: The exposure bias. The unit is the APEX value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.MaxApertureValue
member.summary: The smallest F number of the lens. The unit is the APEX value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SubjectDistance
member.summary: The distance to the subject, given in meters.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.MeteringMode
member.summary: The metering mode.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.LightSource
member.summary: The kind of light source.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Flash
member.summary: This tag indicates the status of flash when the image was shot. Bit 0 indicates the flash firing status, bits 1 and 2 indicate the flash return status, bits 3 and 4 indicate the flash mode, bit 5 indicates whether the flash function is present, and bit 6 indicates "red eye" mode.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SubjectArea
member.summary: This tag indicates the location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FocalLength
member.summary: The actual focal length of the lens, in mm. Conversion is not made to the focal length of a 35 mm film camera.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FlashEnergy
member.summary: Indicates the strobe energy at the time the image is captured, as measured in Beam Candle Power Seconds (BCPS).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SpatialFrequencyResponse
member.summary: This tag records the camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the direction of image width, image height, and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FocalPlaneXResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image width (X) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FocalPlaneYResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image height (Y) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
member.summary: Indicates the unit for measuring FocalPlaneXResolution and FocalPlaneYResolution. This value is the same as the ResolutionUnit.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SubjectLocation
member.summary: Indicates the location of the main subject in the scene. The value of this tag represents the pixel at the center of the main subject relative to the left edge, prior to rotation processing as per the Rotation tag. The first value indicates the X column number and second indicates the Y row number.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ExposureIndex
member.summary: Indicates the exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the image is captured.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SensingMethod
member.summary: Indicates the image sensor type on the camera or input device.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FileSource
member.summary: Indicates the image source. If a DSC recorded the image, this tag value always shall be set to 3.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SceneType
member.summary: Indicates the type of scene. If a DSC recorded the image, this tag value shall always be set to 1, indicating that the image was directly photographed.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.CustomRendered
member.summary: This tag indicates the use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ExposureMode
member.summary: This tag indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot. In auto-bracketing mode, the camera shoots a series of frames of the same scene at different exposure settings.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.WhiteBalance
member.summary: This tag indicates the white balance mode set when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.DigitalZoomRatio
member.summary: This tag indicates the digital zoom ratio when the image was shot. If the numerator of the recorded value is 0, this indicates that digital zoom was not used.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.FocalLengthIn35mmFilm
member.summary: This tag indicates the equivalent focal length assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm. A value of 0 means the focal length is unknown. Note that this tag differs from the FocalLength tag.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.GainControl
member.summary: This tag indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Contrast
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Saturation
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Sharpness
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.DeviceSettingDescription
member.summary: This tag indicates information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SubjectDistanceRange
member.summary: This tag indicates the distance to the subject.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.CompositeImage
member.summary: This tag indicates whether the recorded image is a composite image* or not.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SourceImageNumberOfCompositeImage
member.summary: This tag indicates the number of the source images (tentatively recorded images) captured for a composite Image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.SourceExposureTimesOfCompositeImage
member.summary: For a composite image, this tag records the parameters relating exposure time of the exposures for generating the said composite image, such as respective exposure times of captured source images (tentatively recorded images).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Temperature
member.summary: Temperature as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room temperature where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is C.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Humidity
member.summary: Humidity as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room humidity where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is %.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Pressure
member.summary: Pressure as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room atmospfere where the photographer was holding the camera or the water pressure under the sea. The unit is hPa.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.WaterDepth
member.summary: Water depth as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the water depth of the camera at underwater photography. The unit is m.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.Acceleration
member.summary: Acceleration (a scalar regardless of direction) as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the driving acceleration of the vehicle which the photographer rode on at the shot. The unit is mGal (10-5 m/s2).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.CameraElevationAngle
member.summary: Elevation/depression. angle of the orientation of the camera(imaging optical axis) as the ambient situation at the shot. The unit is degree().

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.ImageUniqueID
member.summary: This tag indicates an identifier assigned uniquely to each image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.LensSpecification
member.summary: This tag notes minimum focal length, maximum focal length, minimum F number in the minimum focal length, and minimum F number in the maximum focal length, which are specification information for the lens that was used in photography.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.LensMake
member.summary: This tag records the lens manufacturer as an ASCII string.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.LensModel
member.summary: This tag records the lenss model name and model number as an ASCII string.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.LensSerialNumber
member.summary: This tag records the serial number of the interchangeable lens that was used in photography as an ASCII string.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType
member.summary: Represents the IFD data type.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.Byte
member.summary: An 8-bit unsigned integer.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.Ascii
member.summary: An 8-bit byte with a 7-bit ASCII character.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.Short
member.summary: A 16-bit unsigned integer.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.Long
member.summary: A 32-bit unsigned integer.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.Rational
member.summary: A pair of LONGs, numerator then denominator.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.SByte
member.summary: An 8-bit signed integer.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.Undefined
member.summary: An undefined 8-bit byte.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.SShort
member.summary: A 16-bit signed integer.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.SLong
member.summary: A 32-bit signed integer.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.SRational
member.summary: A pair of SLONGs, numerator then denominator.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.Float
member.summary: A 4-byte IEEE floating point value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.Double
member.summary: An 8-byte IEEE floating point value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagType.SubIfd
member.summary: A 4-byte long offset value

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffUndefinedTag
member.summary: Represents a TIFF tag with the Undefined type.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Fully mixed directional glyphs.

member.summary: Only strongly left to right.

member.summary: Baseline for font at y=0.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeFlags.LeftSidebearingAtX0
member.summary: Left sidebearing point at x=0 (relevant only for TrueType rasterizers).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeFlags.DependOnPointSize
member.summary: Instructions may depend on point size.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeFlags.ForceToInteger
member.summary: Force ppem to integer values for all internal scaler math; may use fractional ppem sizes if this bit is clear.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeFlags.AlterAdvanceWidth
member.summary: Instructions may alter advance width (the advance widths might not scale linearly).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeFlags.Lossless
member.summary: Font data is lossless as a result of having been subjected to optimizing transformation and/or compression.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeFlags.Converted
member.summary: Font converted (produce compatible metrics).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeFlags.Optimized
member.summary: Font optimized for ClearType.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeFlags.Resort
member.summary: Last Resort font.
